thread.title: Author Tours: Joyce Carol Oates and Natasha Trethewey come to the DMA
thread.title_full: Author Tours: Joyce Carol Oates and Natasha Trethewey come to the DMA | Dallas Morning News

author: dallasnews
title: Author Tours: Joyce Carol Oates and Natasha Trethewey come to the DMA
text:
Joyce Carol Oates (T he Man Without a Shadow ) and Natasha Trethewey (U.S. Poet Laureate 2012-14) will discuss their works at 7:30 p.m. Monday at Dallas Museum of Art,
1717 N. Harwood St., Dallas. $35 for general public, $30 for DMA members and $15 for students with ID.
Kenneth Oppel will sign The Nest at 6 p.m. Tuesday at Barnes & Noble, 2601 Preston Road, Frisco.
Kevin Sands will sign The Blackthorn Key at 6 p.m. Tuesday at Barnes & Noble, 2601 Preston Road, Frisco.
Zsuzsanna Ozsvath will discuss When the Danube Ran Red at 7:30 pm Thursday at Allen Public Library, 300 N. Allen Drive.
Jesse Sublett will discuss and sign 1960s Austin Gangsters: Organized Crime That Rocked the Capital at 6:30 p.m. Thursday at Dallas Heritage Village, 1515 S. Harwood St., Dallas.
Bettie Bearden Pardee will sign Living Newport: Houses, People, Style from 3 to 5 p.m. Friday at Madison 214, 45 Highland Park Village, Dallas.
Cindy Crawford will sign Becoming at 11 a.m. Friday at Barnes & Noble, 7700 W. Northwest Highway, Dallas. Present a B&N receipt for a wristband to save a place in line. Those without receipts may get their wristbands at 10 a.m. Friday. No memorabilia allowed.
Kim Batchelor will read from and sign The Island of Lost Children from 10 a.m. to noon Saturday at Lucky Dog Books, 10801 Garland Road, Dallas. A portion of book proceeds and cash donations will benefit Saving Grace Fund of Animal Allies.
Jacqueline E. Smith ( Lurking in the Deep ), Jill K. Sayre ( The Fairies of Turtle Creek ) and Jeanne Skartsiaris ( Snow Globe ) will sign copies of their books from 3 to 5 p.m. Saturday at Lucky Dog Books, 911 W. Jefferson Blvd., Dallas.
Compiled by Holly Ann Rusak. Email mmerschel@dallasnews.com at least two weeks in advance.
